page.title: 14FISHERTOWN NAIRN
page.content: Long ago the{fishertown}in Nairn was called{Seatown}.The houses were built by the fishermen for their families. The roofs of the houses were all{ thatched.The fishermen used to keep pigs in a small pen at the front of their house, these were helpful in consuming rubbish.A{fishertown}house would have had two rooms upstairs and two rooms downstairs. The houses were very low.They were built close together with their gable-ends facing the sea in an area between the west beach and the harbour.To the visitor the streets of{Park Street,Union {Street,Society Street}and{King Street} seem an unitelliglible maze.Few fishing families live there today but many of the houses have been modernised by the building of extentions containing bathrooms and kitchens.
